text: Would be nice if there was a way to select the revision (or have a version tag) on modules. It would enable users to quickly change between an old and new version of a module on a staged website/landings page. So you could show the new version on the staged page and keep the live site intact. For now I'm doing this by just making a clone of the module and add this one in staged page.
It’s a good, simple idea. Encourage you to add it to the Ideas Forum.  Thanks, <@URH8L415E>

We have APIs for many things in the CMS (and more work is being done).  Let us know if there is something major missing and we can take a look.

Note: We’’re not explicitly trying to be a headless CMS, but it’s reasonable for customers to want to get to the data via an API and use the CMS however it most makes sense.

For anyone interested in setting a default folder for image/file uploads in a module, I've made a new idea here if you'd like to reply/upvote: <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/HubSpot-Ideas/Set-a-default-folder-for-a-file-image-upload/idi-p/322480>
Can we add folders to the website tab in Marketing > Website > Website Pages
I now have “dev” stuff that I would like to keep separate

Hey Andrey, this idea is currently on our idea forum, would you be able to comment on this post with your use case and vote it up? <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/HubSpot-Ideas/Create-easy-folder-to-manage-website-pages/idi-p/278830>
